results.name: a(n) = minimal number of steps to get from n to 1, where a step is x -> 3x-1 if x is odd, or x -> either x/2 or 3x-1 if x is even.
comment: The 3x-1 variation of Collatz conjecture would imply that this sequence is well defined. In turn, if this sequence is well-defined, then A109732 represents a permutation of the odd positive integers.
link: Max Alekseyev, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
program: (PARI) { A261870(n) = my(S, k); S=[n]; k=0; while( S[1]!=1, k++; S=vecsort( concat(apply(x->3*x-1, S), apply(x->x\2, select(x->x%2==0, S) )), , 8);  ); k } /* _Max Alekseyev_, Sep 03 2015 */
